bug.author: jmsking
bug.summary: can not visit the kubeflow web ui according to the official website
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened:
I have install kubeflow according to https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/ Then i run these command as follows: $ kubectl get svc -n istio-system
NAME TYPE CLUSTER-IP EXTERNAL-IP PORT(S) AGE grafana ClusterIP 10.105.105.96 3000/TCP 9d istio-citadel ClusterIP 10.104.62.222 8060/TCP,15014/TCP 9d istio-egressgateway ClusterIP 10.99.162.102 80/TCP,443/TCP,15443/TCP 9d istio-galley ClusterIP 10.105.238.131 443/TCP,15014/TCP,9901/TCP 9d istio-ingressgateway NodePort 10.103.202.229 15020:32695/TCP,80:31380/TCP,443:31390/TCP,31400:31400/TCP,15029:30469/TCP,15030:30275/TCP,15031:30225/TCP,15032:32213/TCP,15443:32747/TCP 9d istio-pilot ClusterIP 10.108.6.253 15010/TCP,15011/TCP,8080/TCP,15014/TCP 9d istio-policy ClusterIP 10.97.249.167 9091/TCP,15004/TCP,15014/TCP 9d istio-sidecar-injector ClusterIP 10.97.133.121 443/TCP 9d istio-telemetry ClusterIP 10.97.17.235 9091/TCP,15004/TCP,15014/TCP,42422/TCP 9d jaeger-agent ClusterIP None 5775/UDP,6831/UDP,6832/UDP 9d jaeger-collector ClusterIP 10.97.171.53 14267/TCP,14268/TCP 9d jaeger-query ClusterIP 10.103.40.12 16686/TCP 9d kiali ClusterIP 10.97.253.249 20001/TCP 9d prometheus ClusterIP 10.103.226.230 9090/TCP 9d tracing ClusterIP 10.97.107.7 80/TCP 9d zipkin ClusterIP 10.109.176.56 9411/TCP 9d Then i want to visit the kubeflow central UI dashboard as presented at https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/other-guides/accessing-uis/, but when i visit http://localhost:8080, there is not a page presented Any help i will appreciate, Thx

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.98. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
could you please check the backend pod and see if it crashes? in such case you need to duplicate the admin secret in istion namespace as well.

Yeahh, i find the pod is ErrImagePull. because i am in china, so i can't visit the gcr.io, but i upload the needed image to nodes, for example: i have upload the image gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/ingress-setup:latest in all nodes. $ docker images | grep gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/ingress-setup gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/ingress-setup latest 0cd6060b6372 13 months ago 256MB And i modify the imagePullPolicy from Always to IfNotPresent using a shell scripts as follows: for file in $(grep -r imagePullPolicy | awk '{print $1}' | sed 's/://g'); do echo $file sed -i 's/Always/IfNotPresent/g' $file done then i check whether modify successful or not as follows: $ grep -r imagePullPolicy then i find all "Always" is replaced by "IfNotPresent" And i delete these pod as follows: $ kubectl delete pod admission-webhook-bootstrap-stateful-set-0 -n kubeflow And i find the pod is still pulling image from "gcr.io/kubeflow-images-public/ingress-setup:latest" so there still throws a ErrImagePull exception <denchmark-h:h3>And i have no ideas to solve these question, so any help i will very appreciated, thanks a lot</denchmark-h>

Have you tried the <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/other-guides/kustomize/>documentation</denchmark-link>
Also contains file which describes this in detail. If this helped, please consider closing the issue.

Thanks for your rapidly reply. i have installed the kubeflow according to this documentation you provided, and i have execute: kfctl init, generate and apply operation in order but sone backend pod is ErrImagePull in kubeflow namespaces
